name: oral cavity
description: Anatomical cavity at the start of the digestive tract that that is enclosed by the mouth. The boundaries and contents vary depending on the species. In vertebrates, the boundaries are the oral opening, the cheeks, the palate and (if present) the palatoglossal arch - if this is not present then the mouth and pharynx form the oropharyngeal cavity. The buccal cavity contains the teeth, tongue and palate (when present)

name: blood
description: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.

name: throat
description: In anatomy, the throat is the anterior part of the neck, in front of the vertebral column. It consists of the pharynx and larynx. An important feature of the throat is the epiglottis, a flap which separates the esophagus from the trachea and prevents inhalation of food or drink. The throat contains various blood vessels, various pharyngeal muscles, the trachea (windpipe) and the esophagus. The hyoid bone and the clavicle are the only bones located in the throat of mammals. It is sometimes considered a synonym for fauces. [WP,unvetted].

name: vagina
description: A fibromuscular tubular tract leading from the uterus to the exterior of the body in female placental mammals and marsupials, or to the cloaca in female birds, monotremes, and some reptiles[WP].
synonyms: distal oviductal region|distal portion of oviduct|vaginae

name: rectum
description: the terminal portion of the intestinal tube, terminating with the anus
synonyms: intestinum rectum|rectal sac|terminal portion of intestine|terminal portion of large intestine

name: caecum
description: A pouch in the digestive tract that connects the ileum with the ascending colon of the large intestine. It is separated from the ileum by the ileocecal valve, and is the beginning of the large intestine. It is also separated from the colon by the cecocolic junction.
synonyms: blind intestine|blindgut|caeca|caecum|ceca|cecum|intestinum caecum|intestinum crassum caecum|intestinum crassum cecum

name: ascending colon
description: Section of colon which is distal to the cecum and proximal to the transversecolon.[FMA,modified]

name: transverse colon
description: The proximal-distal subdivision of colon that runs transversely across the upper part of the abdomen, from the right to the left colic flexure. Continuous with the descending colon[BTO,modified].

name: descending colon
description: The portion of the colon between the left colic flexure and the sigmoid colon at the pelvic brim; the portion of the descending colon lying in the left iliac fossa is sometimes called the iliac colon.

name: sigmoid colon
description: The part of the large intestine that is closest to the rectum and anus. It forms a loop that averages about 40 cm. in length, and normally lies within the pelvis, but on account of its freedom of movement it is liable to be displaced into the abdominal cavity.

name: nasopharynx
description: the section of the pharynx that lies above the soft palate
synonyms: epipharynx|nasal part of pharynx|Nasenrachenraum|pars nasalis pharyngis|rhinopharynx

name: gingiva
description: The fibrous investing tissue, covered by keratinized epithelium, that immediately surrounds a tooth and is contiguous with its periodontal ligament and with the mucosal tissues of the mouth[Glossary of Periodontal Terms 2001].

name: blood plasma
description: The liquid component of blood, in which erythrocytes are suspended.
synonyms: blood plasm|plasma|portion of blood plasma|portion of plasma

name: blood serum
description: The portion of blood plasma that excludes clotting factors.

name: feces
description: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus[MW,modified]
synonyms: cow dung|cow pat|droppings|dung|excrement|excreta|faeces|fecal material|fecal matter|fewmet|frass|guano|matières fécales@fr|merde@fr|ordure|partie de la merde@fr|piece of shit|porción de mierda@es|portion of dung|portion of excrement|portion of faeces|portion of fecal material|portion of fecal matter|portion of feces|portion of guano|portion of scat|portionem cacas|scat|spoor|spraint|stool|teil der fäkalien@de

name: ileum
description: the portion of the small intestine that extends from the jejunum to the colon

name: palatine tonsil
description: tonsils on the left and right sides at the back of the throat. one of the mucosa-associated lymphoid tissues (MALT), located at the entrance to the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts to protect the body from the entry of exogenous material through mucosal sites[WP].

name: hard palate
description: Anterior portion of the palate consisting of bone and mucous membranes[GO]. The hard palate is formed from bony processes of the maxilla, premaxilla and palatine[Kardong].

name: alimentary part of gastrointestinal system
description: The part of the digestive system that excludes the hepatobiliary system.
synonyms: alimentary system|alimentary tract|gastro-intestinal system|gastroenterological system|gastrointestinal (GI) tract|gastrointestinal system|gastrointestinal tract|GI tract

name: external naris
description: A naris that provides one of the small external openings of the head that give passage to air for breathing.

name: buccal mucosa
description: The inner lining of the cheeks and lips.

name: dorsum of tongue
description: The superior surface of the tongue divided by the sulcus terminalis into an anterior two-thirds, the presulcal part (pars presulcalis). and a posterior one-third, the postsulcal part (pars postsulcalis).

name: vagina orifice
description: The median slit located inferior and posterior to the external urethral orifice in the female; the exit for menstrual flow and birth and the entrance for the penis during sexual intercourse; the size and appearance of the vaginal orifice varies inversely with that of the hymen (G. membrane), a thin fold of mucous membrane that surrounds the vaginal orifice
synonyms: introitus|introitus|introitus of vagina|opening of vagina|orifice of vagina|ostium vaginae|vagina opening|vaginal introitus|vaginal orifice

name: posterior fornix of vagina
description: The vaginal fornix that is behind the cervix. It is close to the recto-uterine pouch.
synonyms: pars posterior fornicis vaginae|posterior fornix|posterior part of fornix of vagina
